feed.subtitle: Welcome to Richik Pal's personal website.

entry.content:
Resources for CS189: Machine Learning

Here is a list of resources I used for CS189 at UC Berkeley. I took ths class in Fall 2024. I will be updating this list if I find new resources.

  • Alex Li’s notes for CS189 are intuitive and well-organized. You can find them here
  • Notes from Jonathan Shewchuk’s iteration of the course
  • Notes on Kernel Algorithms
  • Notes on Boosting

Miscellaneous

  • For why PCA works well with Gaussian data, the following StackExchange is insightful.

Check List

  • Brush Teeth
  • Put on socks
    • Put on left sock
    • Put on right sock
  • Go to school

Hoodie Thundercats retro, tote bag 8-bit Godard craft beer gastropub. Truffaut Tumblr taxidermy, raw denim Kickstarter sartorial dreamcatcher. Quinoa chambray slow-carb salvia readymade, bicycle rights 90’s yr typewriter selfies letterpress cardigan vegan.

We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another, unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. —Anais Nin
